Salary Delay.description: Wages are unpaid or delayed beyond the legal wage period.
steps: Step 1: Send a written reminder email to HR or employer requesting pending salary.
Step 2: Issue a formal legal notice citing Payment of Wages Act / Code on Wages.
Step 3: File complaint through Labour Commissioner or SAMADHAN portal.
Step 4: Escalate matter to Labour Court if unresolved.

Unfair Termination.description: Employee dismissed without notice, compensation, or valid procedure.
steps: Step 1: Request written termination reason from employer.
Step 2: Review employment contract and termination clause.
Step 3: File complaint under Industrial Disputes Act.
Step 4: Approach Labour Court or Industrial Tribunal.

Workplace Harassment.description: Sexual harassment or misconduct in workplace.
steps: Step 1: File written complaint to Internal Complaints Committee (ICC).
Step 2: Submit complaint within 3 months of incident.
Step 3: Request interim relief if necessary.
Step 4: If ICC not present, file complaint via SHe-Box portal.

Denial of Benefits.description: Employer not providing EPF, ESI, gratuity or statutory benefits.
steps: Step 1: Verify eligibility under EPF / ESI / Gratuity Act.
Step 2: Submit written request to employer for clarification.
Step 3: File grievance via EPFO or relevant authority portal.
Step 4: Escalate through labour authorities if employer non-compliant.

Overtime Violation.description: Employee not compensated for overtime or excess working hours.
steps: Step 1: Calculate overtime hours based on attendance records.
Step 2: Review applicable wage law or state Shops & Establishments Act.
Step 3: Submit written overtime payment request to employer.
Step 4: File complaint with Labour Department if unpaid.
